messages.message: Hey guys, there are some changes in instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
for example:
if I click on any ipynb file — it opens directly in notebook
instead of showing preview
Why would we make this change?
<!here>
(if you go there manually)
but yeah, i think we should at least get it working with preview, so you can right click and open with preview
nvm, I don't think it's working in text editor either
this must be an intentional change because it requires changing the URL — I’d love to understand the thought process behind the change
yeah! this is a huge pain if the cookies are full! we can't even view the code!
i forgot we actually supported it :slightly_smiling_face:
we can’t leave the bugs like this open

Hello, I made the change to have it go directly to notebook, it sounds like based on my misunderstanding of how notebook works. What was the purpose of having it go to preview before, and what do we expect to have showing up in preview that is not showing up now?

I think one reason is that preview doesn’t require a notebook server to start up, which can sometimes take a while, or sometimes customers don’t have that server up and running? So with preview it can be seen right away
The reason why we open with preview is because we can share the notebook with anyone who can see the input code, output, etc.
opening with the notebook app requires launching a new container for the user who launched it
PR for reference: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/15259

Okay, got it - that PR above was geared towards trying to open things up in editors instead of preview. Preview is still accessible for notebook via right click - is it showing something it's not supposed to in preview?
I'm not sure what it used to look like, but we did make some changes to preview recently that could've changed it
currently preview is broken for notebook even if you open with preview
Ahh is it supposed to be rendering that html versus just showing that markdown?
How about the text editor view, is that functional or also not helpful?
it’s supposed to show the html render of `nbviewer.render()` output
texteditor view of notebook is not useful
notebook is viewed via a special renderer called `nbviewer`
that takes a notebook and returns either a Markdown or HTML
which we need to render in the browser
For notebook, for now, we should keep preview as the default app precisely for the reasons @Aaron Vontell pointed out
Okay, I will fix both the preview app for it and change the default app back. Is this something we should cherry pick into past releases?
not many customers use notebook
so I don’t think we would need hotfix — but would let @shaunak and @Ashish comment on that
It is not the end of the road for the customers. It is easy to work around this problem until we revert to the old user behavior.
